column15: Is there any additional info you feel would be beneficial for us to know, in order to improve our system?

When saying "move pawn to location" if multiple pawns can be moved to the location they don't ask which one to move. It was also a little difficult to read the tile coordinates - could change the graphic so there is the coordinates on each tile. Don't know how much control you have over this but there is a gap in speaking and a response.
I feel like most of the issues came from understanding my speech.
As someone who does not play chess that often, I forgot some of the names of the pieces. Other than that it worked well when it could understand me.
I needed to repeat instructions but that's because of my accent. Other than that it worked fine. The work you have done so far is impressive!

I unfortunately didn't test any sort of help phrases, just the technical aspect. For the most part, it went very smooth in my experience. The only issue I had was with the ability to castle. I tried to say "castle", or "castle kingside" when it was an option, however, the system did not recognize that. Instead, saying "King to G8" worked. This might be unintuitive for newer players.
It took me a second to realize that I don't actually have to press the microphone button. It also had a good amount of issues figuring out what I was saying.

I don't know if it's possible, but making the lag time between Andy saying something and the mic being listened to is pretty long. I'd have a move ready to say and right after Andy would do something, I'd say it. But since there's a lot of lag time, it doesn't actually hear me, or worse, it hears only half of what I say and I have to do it all over again because Andy is confused. I'm not sure if this is something you can fix but that's definetely the biggest thing. Other than that, this was awesome
Just making the speech recognition a little more consistent
Speech recognition process takes a long time; As a user I don't know when I should start talking, is the system waiting for me to say something or it is recognizing my voice.

It looks like Andy is at default going to make the most optimal move like a professional player - might this be a problem for a UI trying to teach people how to play chess? Also it seems to have trouble detecting many of the board positions via speech
Nothing at the moment, since I only tried very simple commands like basic moves.

The system should be able to catch terms much easier. Since it is just looking for a specific phrase sequence the probability that something is a chess move should be much higher. Thus certain words should be removed from the systems lexicon since they are wholly unnecessary like Honda.

It didn't understand when I just said "white", only "white side", so that is something to take into consideration. Also, there was no way for me to go back and change my move once it misunderstood my move. It;s a cool system but for right now I'm not sure what the benefit of this is over just playing on chess.com so I think it would be good if it could teach chess or do something different.
Beware of accents, it'd sometimes get my words wrong.
that was awesome great job guys!
